definition: to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to injure/injury/wound
brain/mind/head/essence
muscle/tendon/veins visible under the skin/sth resembling tendons or veins (e.g. fiber in a vegetable)

sentences.english: For years visas have been a neuralgic issue in the region.
sentences.chinese: 多年来，签证问题一直让该地区大伤脑筋。

sentences.english: Freshman year at college is a very exciting but nerve-wracking experience.
sentences.chinese: 大学第一年令人兴奋，同时也令人伤脑筋。

sentences.english: That's the worst part -- making decisions.
How she should handle this matter troubled her greatly .
sentences.chinese: 她该怎样处理这件事使她大伤脑筋。

sentences.english: They are puzzling through the new rules of the game.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在对新比赛规则大伤脑筋。

sentences.english: He puzzled his brains about the matter.
Fig1. Selection of a proper PR company means a big brain twister…
sentences.chinese: 选择一家适合自已的公关公司是一件伤脑筋的事情。

sentences.english: One of the annoyances of working here is the difficulty of parking near the office.
sentences.chinese: 里工作有一件伤脑筋的事，在办公处附近很难停车。

sentences.english: "I don't have your worries, " quavered the veteran.
sentences.chinese: “我没有你那么多伤脑筋的事，”老兵颤抖抖地说。

sentences.english: I found im having a problem wiz myself.
sentences.chinese: 我就多了个相当伤脑筋的问题。

sentences.english: So they put in nerve-racking 16-hour days and work seven-day weeks.
sentences.chinese: 所以他们将在七天，伤脑筋的截断工作几个星期。

sentences.english: Now I got problem picking loquats.
English grammar tasked the boy' s mind.
sentences.chinese: 英文语法使那男孩大伤脑筋。

sentences.english: The spelling of English is often puzzling.
sentences.chinese: 英语的拼写法常常使人伤脑筋。

sentences.english: He sits puzzling over ancient Hebrew texts.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在那里对着古老的希伯来文本大伤脑筋。

sentences.english: This caused a real dilemma, especially for those in primary care.
sentences.chinese: 这导致了一个大伤脑筋的事，尤其是那些在主要照顾。

definition: to worry/to be anxious
to feel embarrassed/to feel akward
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
(coll.) to feel as though one's head could explode (Tw)
pinyin: yi1 ge5 tou2 liang3 ge5 da4

definition: concerned/worried/disturbed/anxious
to have a big head/(fig.) to get a headache/one's head is swimming
thorny (problem)/intractable
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to remain puzzled after pondering over sth a hundred times (idiom)/to remain perplexed despite much thought
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
see 百思不解[bai3 si1 bu4 jie3]
pinyin: bai3 si1 bu4 de2 qi2 jie3

definition: unable to understand/unable to get over
to worry about
brains/mind/head/way of thinking
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
